author: Special Correspondent
text:
Inspector of Police R. Soundarapandian of Madurai City Police was punished with “rank reduction” to Sub-Inspector of Police following a court direction for departmental action against him for failure in proper presentation of a murder case that led to acquittal of all the accused.

Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav issued the order of “rank reduction” for a one-year period on Monday to Mr. Soundarapandian, who is currently Inspector of Police (Crime) attached to Keeraithurai station.

Police sources said that he would have to serve as an SI for one year after which he would again be promoted as Inspector of Police.

The then Principal District Judge W. Sadasivam held the prosecution responsible in 2014 for the acquittal of all accused in the murder case registered by R.S. Mangalam police.

Mr. Sundarapandian was the investigation officer. A team of higher police officials that enquired into the case also recommended the punishment, the sources said.
title: Inspector of Police demoted
